admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic Management Assistance
            Project supports measures to: a) upgrade macroeconomic
            management and public administration; b) reform public
            enterprises; and c) strengthen the competitiveness of
            Thailand's industrial sector. The project consists of
            four components. The first component will streamline
            economic management through macroeconomic analysis and data
            management, public resource management, and public
            administration. The second component will reform public
            enterprises by supporting the Government's program for
            divesting public enterprises, designing an adequate
            regulatory framework and improving the performance
            monitoring of state-owned enterprises retained in public
            ownership. The third component will strengthen industrial
            competitiveness of the private sector by improving the
            industrial sector knowledge base, upgrading industrial
            technology and facilitating trade. The fourth component
            focuses on project coordination and implementation by
            strengthening institutional capacity.
